embeds.title: Gremlin Arms
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :energy_gremlins: / The Gremlins / Downfall

Gain a random assortment of 2 (3) Shivs and Wards.

messages.content: I can't say much about this card
it triggers gremlin passives well
yay
Gremlin arms deciding whether to give full shivs on defect 1 sunder or full wards on watcher 2 intangible turn
https://tenor.com/view/two-face-coin-batman-harvey-gif-18731309
Horrible card, could just be a screen to pick shivs or wards
they took their fucking arms
so THAT'S where the arms from Disarm go
the disarm to gremlin arms pipeline

From a flavor standpoint, I love this card, the random element feels so fitting of having a bunch of scrappy gremlins working together to take on the spire, and shivs in particular really fit gremlins flavor well. It also blends well with the cheap card spam synergies that gremlins have going on in both their inherent passives and cards.

During gameplay however, I have been dissapointed by this card almost every time. For starters, the numbers just don't line up. 2 shivs is 8 damage, and 2 wards is 6 block. A ward and a shiv is 4 damage and 3 block. This is all well below average when compared to standard commons like iron wave, and you don't even get to choose which option you are getting. Sure, if you have the right gremlin in front, you get extra benefits, like weak or extra damage on the shivs, or wiz and extra block on the wards, but that's leaning into the inconsistencies even more. You really only want gremlin arms when are very heavily invested in card spam strategies, and I usually find that there are much more reliable options when that's the case.

It's terrible in act 1, the wards and shivs get wrecked by lagavulin, and it's a skill that can easily generate more skills into gremlin nob. The numbers being generally poor also means that it just won't do much to get you through hallway fights either, especially since most early hallway fights are races where you really need the damage more than the wards. The upgrade is good, it's a +4 if you roll an extra shiv, and very relevant for the card spam synergies, but also leans into the variance even harder since you can theoretically get even worse results with 3 random outcomes. It does also have some good relic synergies, ink bottle being the most notable, but also letter opener, oddly smooth stone, ninja relics, and vajra/girya. My baseline is that this card isn't good enough unless I have lots of synergies with it, and even then I would prefer it to be pre-upgraded. Other cards support card spam better.
i wonder what needs to happen in a run for this to be pickable

Without any synergies for this card though its rather weak since this is a character that has 16 damage commons.

embeds.title: Polish
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_gremlins: / The Gremlins / Downfall

Shivs deal 2 (3) additional damage.
Wards grant 2 (3) additional **Block** :p_block:.

messages.content: my issue is its kind of the bottom of the barrel and grems really like the skip button imo
of course with just one normal polish that would be a hypothetical 18 damage 14 block gremlin arms+ and it just goes up and up from there
all for 1 energy on a common being paired with some of the best cards gremlins already have. I've not even mentioned other synergies that get better like flurry and second volley.
alright I don't play enough of this character to understand this.

gremlins really like spammy cards in general because most of what the character can do benefits from playing as many cards as you possibly can. Gremlin arms in its current state mostly struggles because the cards it generates are unreliable compared to its more consistent competition thats generating the same quantity of cards and doing more things (like astound, fairy dust, pin needle, shank stone and glitter guard).

for the record I don't think a gremlin arms giving 4 random things would break the character, the gremlins are already the best to begin with. I just think that it it introduces yet another super powerful card into an ocean of cards that already make watcher cards look bad.
on the topic of spamming cards I wonder how different the gremlins meta would be if the act 4 boss had beat of death like the heart does.
not very
edible armor and heckle still reign supreme
i mean i think it would be much harder
the neow healing thing is incredibly whatever
and  u don't always get/draw the block engine cards
Its beat of death on top of thorns though; already sneaky gremlin decks are quite concerned with those thorns and have to take the fight slower
oh snecko would also be hit really hard by that change since its the other spam cards character.

I can confirm that god of life makes neow a much easier fight for most characters compared to beat of death for the heart. As long as you have reasonable damage scaling, the healing is fairly negligible (I find that champ has the hardest time chewing through the extra health). Beat of death on the other hand really punishes card spamming, and puts far more pressure on the players health. Beat of death really forces you to get some kind of consistent block engine going quickly
1 hp is about 1.5% of your max hp. 2 hp is .25% of Neow's max hp.
So losing 1.5% of your max hp in damage compared to having to do an extra .2% more damage.
Sure it adds up, but nothing like beat of death does
